'London Overground' ('LO') is an urban and suburban rail network in the United
Kingdom. Established in 2007, it serves a large part of
Greater London and parts of Hertfordshire, with 83 stations  on six lines. The network is
operated by London Overground Rail Operations (LOROL) as part of the National
Rail network, under the franchise control and branding of Transport
for London (TfL). On 11 February 2013, it was announced that LOROL had been
awarded a concession extension until 14 November 2016.
categories: Electric railways in the United Kingdom
